question.text:
Which of these phases of the menstrual cycle is correctly matched with its period?

(I) Menstrual phase: 1st-4th Day
(II) Proliferative phase: 5th-13th Day
(III) Ovulatory phase: 14th Day
(IV) Luteal phase: 15th-28th Day

solution.text: The series of cyclic changes that take place in simultaneously in the ovaries and uterine wall (endometrium) of female reproductive tract stimulated by different concentrations of gonadotropins like FSH and LH is called menstrual cycle. It is mainly made up of 4 phases: Menstrual phase or Destructive phase - <math><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi></mrow></msup></math>  Day - endometrium degenerate. Proliferative phase or Follicular phase - 5 <math><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi></mrow></msup></math>  Day - High F.S.H. level stimulates primordial follicle to mature into Graafian Follicle. Ovulatory phase -  <math><msup><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi></mrow></msup></math>  Day - release of ovum. Luteal phase or Secretory phase -  <math><msup><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi></mrow></msup></math>  Day - rise in progesterone levels and the endometrium secretes nutrients for implantation
